result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael J Johann

defendant.name: Johann, Michael J
defendant.address: 2718 N Elco Rd Lot 22, Fall Creek, WI 54742

records.addlTxt:
(Cases 22CF198, 22CF280, 22CT249 are called at 10:04 AM- by Zoom) Defendant Michael J Johann in court.  Attorney Bryant S Plank appeared by video for Michael J Johann. Attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defense waives reading of the complaint in 22CT249. Defense recites the joint sentence recommendation. Defendant pleads No Contest to 22CF198 Count 1- Possession of Methamphetamine and 22TR4715- Operating without insurance. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. Court accepts plea and finds the Defendant guilty. Remaining charges are dismissed and read in, including 22CF280, 22CT249, 22TR1271. 
Court orders in 22TR4715- $200.50 forfeiture. 
Court withholds sentence in 22CF198 and orders 12 months Probation with the following conditions: AODA and follow through with recommendations; Not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol is primarily served/sold; Not to consume/use/possess any illegal drugs/non-prescribed medications or drug paraphernalia; No contact with any known drug dealers/users except in a therapeutic setting; Maintain absolute sobriety; Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations; Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge; Court costs. Court orders 3 days jail credit, if revoked.
Defendant's Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing

(10:20 AM cases 22CF198, 22CF280 called.) All parties and court personnel appear via Zoom. 
Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Michael J Johann appeared by video. Attorney Bryant S Plank in court for Michael J Johann.
Defendant waives right to a personal appearance and wants to proceed. Court accepts the defendant's waiver to a personal appearance.
Attorney Plank advises is awaiting further discovery and an initial offer.
Status Conference scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 11:15 am via Zoom for the defendant.

(10:33 AM cases 22CF198, 22CF280 called.) All parties and court personnel appear via Zoom. 
Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Michael J Johann appeared by video. Attorney Bryant S Plank appeared by video for Michael J Johann. 
Defendant waives right to a personal appearance and wants to proceed. Court accepts the defendant's waiver to a personal appearance.
Defendant waives reading of Information in cases 22CF198, 22CF280 and enters Not Guilty pleas to all counts in all cases, which the Court receives.
Attorney Plank requests to schedule a status conference.
Status Conference scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 10:15 am via Zoom.

Conditions: 
No contact with anyone involved in illegal drug activities, except in a therapeutic setting. 
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.  
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level.

(Cases 22CF198, 22CF280 are called at 10:01 AM) Prosecuting attorney Afton Brianna Lewis Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Michael J Johann in court.  Attorney Bryant S Plank appeared by video for Michael J Johann. 
Defense waives reading of the complaint in 22CF280. Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver in 22CF198, 22CF280. 
Arraignment to be scheduled in 22CF198 and 22CF280 with Branch 5 Judicial Assistant.

Conditions:
No contact with anyone involved in illegal drug activities, except in a therapeutic setting. .
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level.
